verses.verse: Then Job <WH347> answered <WH6030> <WH853> the LORD, <WH3068> and said, <WH559>
I know <WH3045> that <WH3588> thou canst do <WH3201> every <WH3605> thing, and that no <WH3808> thought <WH4209> can be withheld <WH1219> from <WH4480> thee.

Who <WH4310> is he <WH2088> that hideth <WH5956> counsel <WH6098> without <WH1097> knowledge? <WH1847> therefore <WH3651> have I uttered <WH5046> that I understood <WH995> not; <WH3808> things too wonderful <WH6381> for <WH4480> me, which I knew <WH3045> not. <WH3808>
Hear, <WH8085> I beseech thee, <WH4994> and I <WH595> will speak: <WH1696> I will demand <WH7592> of thee, and declare <WH3045> thou unto me.
I have heard <WH8085> of thee by the hearing <WH8088> of the ear: <WH241> but now <WH6258> mine eye <WH5869> seeth <WH7200> thee.
Wherefore <WH5921> <WH3651> I abhor <WH3988> myself, and repent <WH5162> in <WH5921> dust <WH6083> and ashes. <WH665>

And it was <WH1961> so, that after <WH310> the LORD <WH3068> had spoken <WH1696> <WH853> these <WH428> words <WH1697> unto <WH413> Job, <WH347> the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> to <WH413> Eliphaz <WH464> the Temanite, <WH8489> My wrath <WH639> is kindled <WH2734> against thee, and against thy two <WH8147> friends: <WH7453> for <WH3588> ye have not <WH3808> spoken <WH1696> of <WH413> me the thing that is right, <WH3559> as my servant <WH5650> Job <WH347> hath.

Therefore take <WH3947> unto you now <WH6258> seven <WH7651> bullocks <WH6499> and seven <WH7651> rams, <WH352> and go <WH1980> to <WH413> my servant <WH5650> Job, <WH347> and offer up <WH5927> for <WH1157> yourselves a burnt offering; <WH5930> and my servant <WH5650> Job <WH347> shall pray <WH6419> for <WH5921> you: for <WH3588> <WH518> him <WH6440> will I accept: <WH5375> lest <WH1115> I deal <WH6213> with <WH5973> you after your folly, <WH5039> in that <WH3588> ye have not <WH3808> spoken <WH1696> of <WH413> me the thing which is right, <WH3559> like my servant <WH5650> Job. <WH347>

So Eliphaz <WH464> the Temanite <WH8489> and Bildad <WH1085> the Shuhite <WH7747> and Zophar <WH6691> the Naamathite <WH5284> went, <WH1980> and did <WH6213> according as <WH834> the LORD <WH3068> commanded <WH1696> <WH413> them: the LORD <WH3068> also accepted <WH5375> <WH6440> <WH853> Job. <WH347>

And the LORD <WH3068> turned <WH7725> <WH853> the captivity <WH7622> of Job, <WH347> when he prayed <WH6419> for <WH1157> his friends: <WH7453> also the LORD <WH3068> gave <WH3254> Job <WH347> <WH853> twice <WH4932> as much as he had before. <WH3605> <WH834>

Then came <WH935> there unto <WH413> him all <WH3605> his brethren, <WH251> and all <WH3605> his sisters, <WH269> and all <WH3605> they that had been of his acquaintance <WH3045> before, <WH6440> and did eat <WH398> bread <WH3899> with <WH5973> him in his house: <WH1004> and they bemoaned <WH5110> him, and comforted <WH5162> him over <WH5921> all <WH3605> the evil <WH7451> that <WH834> the LORD <WH3068> had brought <WH935> upon <WH5921> him: every man <WH376> also gave <WH5414> him a piece of money, <WH7192> <WH259> and every one <WH376> an <WH259> earring <WH5141> of gold. <WH2091>

So the LORD <WH3068> blessed <WH1288> <WH853> the latter end <WH319> of Job <WH347> more than his beginning: <WH4480> <WH7225> for he had <WH1961> fourteen <WH702> <WH6240> thousand <WH505> sheep, <WH6629> and six <WH8337> thousand <WH505> camels, <WH1581> and a thousand <WH505> yoke <WH6776> of oxen, <WH1241> and a thousand <WH505> she asses. <WH860>
He had <WH1961> also seven <WH7658> sons <WH1121> and three <WH7969> daughters. <WH1323>

And he called <WH7121> the name <WH8034> of the first, <WH259> Jemima; <WH3224> and the name <WH8034> of the second, <WH8145> Kezia; <WH7103> and the name <WH8034> of the third, <WH7992> Keren-happuch. <WH7163>

And in all <WH3605> the land <WH776> were no <WH3808> women <WH802> found <WH4672> so fair <WH3303> as the daughters <WH1323> of Job: <WH347> and their father <WH1> gave <WH5414> them inheritance <WH5159> among <WH8432> their brethren. <WH251>

After <WH310> this <WH2063> lived <WH2421> Job <WH347> a hundred <WH3967> and forty <WH705> years, <WH8141> and saw <WH7200> <WH853> his sons, <WH1121> and <WH853> his sons' <WH1121> sons, <WH1121> even four <WH702> generations. <WH1755>
So Job <WH347> died, <WH4191> being old <WH2205> and full <WH7649> of days. <WH3117>
